library(tidyverse)
library(reshape2)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(ggridges)
library(gridExtra)

## Clear workspace
rm(list=ls())

## Read in .csv file
data<-read_csv("tidy_tuesday_week2.csv",col_names=TRUE)

## Replace all NAs with 0
data[is.na(data)] <- 0

## Change year coloumn to character type
data$year<-as.character(data$year)

## Average all numeric columns
avgdf<-data %>% group_by(year) %>% summarise_if(is.numeric, mean)

## Melt data frame (avg) & add group column
dfm<-melt(avgdf, id.vars="year")
dfm$group<-c("Average")

## Melt data frame (norm) & add group column
dfm2<-melt(data, id.vars="year")
dfm2$group<-c("Normal")

## Combine both data frames into one
totald<-rbind(dfm,dfm2)

## Create ridges object
A<-ggplot(totald, aes(x=value, y=reorder(variable, desc(variable)), fill=variable, color=variable)) +
  geom_density_ridges(scale=3) +
  theme(legend.position="none") +
  ylab("Position") +
  xlab("Salary") +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = dollar) +
  facet_wrap(~ group) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))

## Save to file
pdf("ridges.avg.vs.norm.pdf")
plot(A)
dev.off()
